intro: Solanum indicum var. arussorum, commonly known as the Indian nightshade, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its oval, dark green leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range from white to violet. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Due to its toxic properties, it is not recommended for consumption or cultivation in edible gardens.
